title: Amnesty International slam UK and US over ‘appalling lack of leadership’ in refugee crisis
text:
Amnesty International slam UK and US over ‘appalling lack of leadership’ in refugee crisis Amnesty International slam UK and US over ‘appalling lack of leadership’ in refugee crisis BRITAIN and the US have been accused of showing an "appalling lack of leadership" over the international refugee crisis. PUBLISHED: PUBLISHED: 00:01, Wed, Feb 22, 2017 GETTY Amnesty International claimed the UK's lack of leadership forced refugees to seek people smugglers 
Amnesty International claimed the UK Government has shirked its duty in relation to the emergency, pushing thousands of vulnerable people into the hands of people smugglers. 
It attacked the closure of the Dubs Amendment scheme to bring unaccompanied children to Britain from Europe as "shameful". 
Kate Allen, Director of Amnesty International UK, said: "We are witnessing the worst refugee crisis since the Second World War and wealthy nations like the UK and the US have shown an appalling lack of leadership and responsibility. Related articles Angela Merkel deports record 80,000 asylum seekers in one year 
"History will judge us for this. 
"When language around 'taking our country back' and 'making America great again' is coupled with proposals to treat EU migrants like bargaining chips or to ban refugees on the grounds of religion, it fosters deep hatred and mistrust and sends a strong message that some people are entitled to human rights and others aren't. 
"This toxic rhetoric being used by politicians around the world risks taking us into a dark age of human rights and could lead to profound consequences for all of us."
